alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Queen Anne`s, northeastern Caroline and Kent Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rock Hall, or near Bodkin Point, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centerville, Chestertown, Centreville, Greensboro, Oakland, Rock Hall, Church Hill, Millington, Sudlersville, Goldsboro, Old Town, Langford, Overton, Starkey Corner, Morgnec, Massey, Crumpton, Carville, Hope and Henderson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
